alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 11:43AM EST until February 26 at 1:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Conewango Creek At Russell affecting Warren County. For the Conewango Creek...including Russell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Conewango Creek At Russell. * WHEN...From this evening to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Both banks begin to overflow, affecting low lying areas. At 9.0 feet, A number of homes on the right, or west bank are affected by high water. At 10.0 feet, A number of homes on the right, or west bank are affected. The roadway on the left bank is also affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 9.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1145 PM EST.
